name: yara-x-ls
description: The official YARA language extension. Provides syntax highlighting, autocompletion and more.

alignMetadata.markdownDescription:
Aligns the values in the `meta` section of a rule.

**Example:**

*Original code:*
```yara
rule example {
  meta:
    author = "John Doe"
    creation_date = "2024-01-01"
    description = "A simple example rule."
}
```

*Formatted code:*
```yara
rule example {
  meta:
    author        = "John Doe"
    creation_date = "2024-01-01"
    description   = "A simple example rule."
}
```

indentSectionHeaders.markdownDescription:
Indent section headers (`meta`, `strings`, `condition`).

**Example:**

*Original code:*
```yara
rule example {
meta:
  author = "John Doe"
strings:
  $a = "some string"
condition:
  $a
}
```

*Formatted code:*
```yara
rule example {
  meta:
    author = "John Doe"
  strings:
    $a = "some string"
  condition:
    $a
}
```

indentSectionContents.markdownDescription:
Indent the content of rule sections.

**Example:**

*Original code:*
```yara
rule example {
  meta:
  author = "John Doe"
  strings:
  $a = "some string"
  condition:
  $a
}
```

*Formatted code:*
```yara
rule example {
  meta:
    author = "John Doe"
  strings:
    $a = "some string"
  condition:
    $a
}
```

emptyLineBeforeSectionHeader.description: Inserts an empty line before each section header.

emptyLineAfterSectionHeader.description: Inserts an empty line after each section header.

newlineBeforeCurlyBrace.description: Puts the opening curly brace on a new line.

YARA.metadataValidation.description: Rules for validating metadata in YARA rules.

required.description: Specifies if the metadata is required.

type.description: The expected type of the metadata value.

YARA.ruleNameValidation.description: A regular expression that all rule names must match (example: APT_.*).
